extends java.lang.Object
    Solves equations and simplifies expressions

    Nateowami

    • Constructor Detail

      • Solver

        public Solver(java.lang.String equation,
      Solver.SolveFor selection)
        Creates a new Solver so you can call getSolution().
        Parameters:
        equation - The equation or expression to solve, simplify, factor, multiply, etc
        selection - The user's selection. Do they want this to be factored, solved, simplified, or what? See Solver.SolveFor.

    • Method Detail

      • getSolution

        public Solution getSolution()
        Returns:
        A Solution object that contains all the steps for solving

      • whichIsFinished

        private int whichIsFinished(java.util.ArrayList<Solution> solList)
        Tells if we're done solving. It looks through the list of solutions and finds one that is solved, simplified, or whatever needs to be done to it. Returns positive int if it finds one, -1 if there is no solution yet
        Parameters:
        solList - The list of Solutions to check
        Returns:
        The index of a Solution that is fully solved

      • isSimplified

        private boolean isSimplified(AlgebraicParticle expr)
        Tells if an expression is fully simplified. Examples: 23(2)/(3) Works best for fractions. If it's complicated it's unreliable and will return false
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to check
        Returns:
        If the expr is fully simplified

      • getBestSolution

        private Solution getBestSolution(java.util.ArrayList<Solution> solutions)
        Tells which Solution is the best
        Parameters:
        solutions - An ArrayList of Solutions to search
        Returns:
        The Solution that is solved the best, or null if no solutions are given.

      • getAlgorithms

        private java.util.ArrayList<Algorithm> getAlgorithms(Solver.SolveFor selection)
        Returns the applicable solving algorithms for the selection, e.g., algorithms for solving, simplifying, factoring, etc.
        Parameters:
        selection - The user's selection.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of algorithms applicable for the selection.
